1.text: Pour 4 oz (120 mL) of non-washable school glue into a bowl.

2.text: Add 1/2 cup (120 mL) of water and stir until the mixture is completely smooth.

3.text: Stir in 2-4 drops of food coloring if you want colored putty.

4.text: Dissolve 1/2 tsp (4 g) of Borax in 1/4 cup (60 mL) of hot water.

5.text: Pour the dissolved Borax into the glue mixture and stir it together.

6.text: Knead the mixture until it turns stretchy.

7.text: Store the putty in an airtight container.

8.text: Purchase a bag of basecoat plaster.

9.text: Pour a handful of plaster onto the tray and make a well in the center.

10.text: Pour a small amount of water into the center of the well.

11.text: Use a drywall scraper to fold the water into the plaster.

13.text: Spread the glue from a glue stick all over a flat surface.

14.text: Let the glue dry for about 1 day.

15.text: Peel the glue off of the lid and stretch it, then put it back.

16.text: Repeat the stretching and drying process for 2-3 more days.

17.text: Use your putty when it becomes stretchy.
